page.title: 16Winmarleigh Field Day(1)
page.content: The{Field Day}is held annually on the 2nd or 3rd Saturday in{July.}It is many months in preparation. The Committee start the events holding a Hot-Pot Supper in the winter at which lots are drawn to choose the{ {Queen}from the eligible girls of the village. The Committee then meet and select the retinue of the new Queen and set into motion the making of dresses,trousers and accessories.They also have to arrange for visiting 'Queens',a Band, Morris Dancers or similar troupe, in readiness for the{Procession. Early on the 'biig day' parents are up and about setting out the 'crowning rostrum' and making teas in readiness for the afternoon. By lunchtime the Village Hall and its surrounds are ready for the days fun.
